descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course explores the formal analysis of linguistic meaning, with an emphasis on different frameworks that are used to model compositional interpretation. Students will learn the essentials of semantic argumentation, and practice developing and evaluating hypotheses about the nature and construction of linguistic meaning. Topics include the interface between morphosyntax and semantics, scope, quantification, and argument structure.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will become comfortable using different frameworks for modeling compositional semantic interpretation, and develop and evaluate hypotheses about the nature and construction of linguistic meaning.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Homework, class presentation, review papers, research proposal.
